00061 namespace phys{
00062     class ActorBase;
00063     class World;
00064     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00065     /// @class AreaEffect
00066     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00067     /// @brief This class is used to define area's in the world that have unique effects.
00068     /// @details Common uses for this class are for gravity fields, and explosions.  But can be made to do more. @n
00069     /// Note: This is a base class intended to be derived from.  This class cannot be created itself.  To make an
00070     /// AreaEffect class that does what you want it to, simple inherit from this class with an AE class of your own,
00071     /// and define the ApplyEffect() function to do what you want your effect to do.
00072     ///////////////////////////////////////
00073     class PHYS_LIB AreaEffect
00074     {
00075         friend class PhysicsManager;
00076         protected:
00077             enum AEShapeType
00078             {
00079                 AE_Sphere,
00080                 AE_CylinderX,
00081                 AE_CylinderY,
00082                 AE_CylinderZ,
00083                 AE_Box,
00084                 AE_Custom,
00085                 AE_Unassigned
00086             };
00087             /// @brief The name of the Area Effect.
00088             String Name;
00089             /// @brief The type of physics shape in use by this AE field.
00090             AEShapeType ShapeType;
00091             /// @brief Stores the shape of the AE field.
00092             btCollisionShape* Shape;
00093             /// @brief The object representing the AE field itself.
00094             btPairCachingGhostObject* Ghost;
00095             /// @brief Ogre node required to adding a graohical representation to the scene graph.
00096             Ogre::SceneNode* GraphicsNode;
00097             /// @brief The Ogre object being added to the scene graph.
00098             Ogre::Entity* GraphicsObject;
00099             /// @brief World pointer simply to enable the effects of this class to be as diverse as the engine features.
00100             World* TheWorld;
00101             /// @brief Container for actors within the field area.
00102             std::list < ActorBase* > OverlappingActors;
00103             /// @brief Container of actors that have been added since last frame.
00104             std::vector < ActorBase* > AddedActors;
00105             /// @brief Container of actors that have been removed since last frame.
00106             std::vector < ActorBase* > RemovedActors;
00107             /// @brief Constructor Function.
00108             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00109             virtual void CreateGhostObject(const Vector3 Location);
00110             /// @brief Creates a basic material in code using the provided colour.
00111             virtual Ogre::MaterialPtr CreateColouredMaterial(const ColourValue& Colour);
00112             /// @brief Helper function for adding actors to relevant lists.
00113             virtual void AddActorToList(ActorBase* Actor);
00114             /// @brief Helper function for adding actors to relevant lists.
00115             virtual void RemoveActorFromList(ActorBase* Actor);
00116         public:
00117             /// @brief Constructor.
00118             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00119             /// @param name The name of the field.
00120             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00121             AreaEffect(const String &name, const Vector3 Location);
00122             /// @brief Destructor.
00123             /// @details Class destructor.
00124             virtual ~AreaEffect();
00125             /// @brief Defines and applies the effect of the field.
00126             /// @details When inheriting this class, this function is what defines the effect the field has. @n
00127             /// This function will be called on by the physics manager and shouldn't be called manually.
00128             virtual void ApplyEffect() = 0;
00129             /// @brief Updates the actors listed as within the field.
00130             /// @details This function is automatically called once every simulation step.  This shouldn't
00131             /// be called manually unless your usage of this class requires more then one update per step.
00132             virtual void UpdateActorList();
00133             /// @brief Creates a Sphere shape for the field.
00134             /// @param Radius The radius of the sphere you want to create.
00135             void CreateSphereShape(const Real Radius);
00136             /// @brief Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the X axis.
00137             /// @details When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (width*0.5, radius, radius),
00138             /// with the second radius perpendicular to the first.
00139             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00140             void CreateCylinderShapeX(const Vector3 HalfExtents);
00141             /// @brief Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the Y axis.
00142             /// @details When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, height*0.5, radius),
00143             /// with the second radius perpendicular to the first.
00144             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00145             void CreateCylinderShapeY(const Vector3 HalfExtents);
00146             /// @brief Creates a Cylinder shape for the field that is alligned on the Z axis.
00147             /// @details When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, radius, length*0.5),
00148             /// with the second radius perpendicular to the first.
00149             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00150             void CreateCylinderShapeZ(const Vector3 HalfExtents);
00151             /// @brief Creates a Box shape for the field.
00152             /// @details When making the vector to be passed in, remember to pass in only half values of what you want the actual
00153             /// size to be.
00154             /// @param HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.
00155             void CreateBoxShape(const Vector3 HalfExtents);
00156             /// @brief Creates a shape from a .mesh model for the field.
00157             /// @param Filename The name of the .mesh file to be used.
00158             /// @param Group The resource group where the mesh can be found.
00159             /// @param MakeVisible If true, this function will create a visual representation from the same mesh provided.
00160             void CreateShapeFromMesh(String Filename, String Group, bool MakeVisible);
00161             /// @brief Sets the scale of the shape of the field.
00162             /// @details The default scale is 1.0.
00163             /// @param Scale The vector3 representing the scale you wish to apply to each axis of the field shape.
00164             void ScaleFieldShape(const Vector3 Scale);
00165             /// @brief Gets the scale of the shape of the field.
00166             /// @details The default scale is 1.0.
00167             /// @return Returns the current scale applied to the fields shape.
00168             Vector3 GetFieldShapeScale();
00169             /// @brief Sets the origin for the area effect.
00170             /// @details In most cases you won't want to call this, with the exception of when you want a field to follow/track an actor.
00171             /// @param Location The updated location of the origin for the field.
00172             void SetLocation(const Vector3 Location);
00173             /// @brief Gets the origin for the area effect.
00174             /// @details This function is particularly useful when making fields such as gravity wells, that have continuous effects centering on one location.
00175             /// @return Returns the vector3 representing the location of the area effect.
00176             Vector3 GetLocation();
00177             /// @brief Gets the Area Effects name.
00178             /// @return Returns the name of the Area Effect.
00179             ConstString& GetName();
00180             /// @brief Gets the current shape type in use by this class.
00181             /// @return Returns an enum value representing the type of shape being used by this class.
00182             AreaEffect::AEShapeType GetShapeType();
00183             /// @brief Creates a sphere mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00184             /// @details This function will create a material script on the fly for you to use with your AR field.
00185             /// @param Colour The colour to put into the custom created material script.  This will be the final colour of the graphics object.
00186             /// @param Rings The number of horizontal rings the sphere is to be comprised of.
00187             /// This along with the segments parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere.  Less then 16 is not recommended.
00188             /// @param Segments The number of vertical rings the sphere is to be comprised of.
00189             /// This along with the rings parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere.  Less then 16 is not recommended.
00190             virtual void CreateGraphicsSphere(const ColourValue& Colour, const Whole Rings = 16, const Whole Segments = 16);
00191             /// @brief Creates a sphere mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00192             /// @param MaterialName The name of the material script to be applied to the graphics object that is created.  Must be valid.
00193             /// @param Rings The number of horizontal rings the sphere is to be comprised of.
00194             /// This along with the segments parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere.  Less then 16 is not recommended.
00195             /// @param Segments The number of vertical rings the sphere is to be comprised of.
00196             /// This along with the rings parameter controls the overall resolution of the sphere.  Less then 16 is not recommended.
00197             virtual void CreateGraphicsSphere(String& MaterialName, const Whole Rings = 16, const Whole Segments = 16);
00198             /// @brief Creates a cylinder mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00199             /// @details This function will create a material script on the fly for you to use with your AR field.
00200             /// @param Colour The colour to put into the custom created material script.  This will be the final colour of the graphics object.
00201             virtual void CreateGraphicsCylinder(const ColourValue& Colour);
00202             /// @brief Creates a cylinder mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00203             /// @param MaterialName The name of the material script to be applied to the graphics object that is created.  Must be valid.
00204             virtual void CreateGraphicsCylinder(String& MaterialName);
00205             /// @brief Creates a box mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00206             /// @details This function will create a material script on the fly for you to use with your AR field.
00207             /// @param Colour The colour to put into the custom created material script.  This will be the final colour of the graphics object.
00208             virtual void CreateGraphicsBox(const ColourValue& Colour);
00209             /// @brief Creates a box mesh based on the physics shape for this area effect.
00210             /// @param MaterialName The name of the material script to be applied to the graphics object that is created.  Must be valid.
00211             virtual void CreateGraphicsBox(String& MaterialName);
00212             /// @brief Gets the list of actors within this field.
00213             /// @return Returns the list of actors contained within this field.
00214             std::list<ActorBase*>& GetOverlappingActors();
00215             /// @brief Gets the list of actors that have been added to the list since the last simulation step.
00216             /// @return Returns the vector storing all the actors that have been added to the list since the last simulation step.
00217             std::vector<ActorBase*>& GetAddedActors();
00218             /// @brief Gets the list of actors that have been removed from the list since the last simulation step.
00219             /// @return Returns the vector storing all the actors that have been removed from the list since the last simulation step.
00220             std::vector<ActorBase*>& GetRemovedActors();
00221     };//areaeffect

00223     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00224     /// @class TestAE
00225     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00226     /// @brief This is a dummy class to test if the AE field works.  Details will be output to the log.
00227     ///////////////////////////////////////
00228     class PHYS_LIB TestAE : public AreaEffect
00229     {
00230         public:
00231             /// @brief Constructor.
00232             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00233             /// @param name The name of the field.
00234             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00235             TestAE(const String &name, Vector3 Location);
00236             /// @brief Destructor.
00237             /// @details Class destructor.
00238             ~TestAE();
00239             /// @brief Applies the effect this field has to object inside.
00240             /// @details This function defines the behavior for the class.
00241             virtual void ApplyEffect();
00242     };//testAE
00243 
00244     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00245     /// @class GravityField
00246     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00247     /// @brief This is a gravity field implementation of the AreaEffect class.
00248     /// @details This class is not a gravity well, where gravity is pulling to one point.  Instead this class uniformly
00249     /// pulls gravity in one direction that is different from the world gravity.
00250     ///////////////////////////////////////
00251     class PHYS_LIB GravityField : public AreaEffect
00252     {
00253         protected:
00254             /// @brief The stored value for this fields gravity.
00255             Vector3 Grav;
00256         public:
00257             /// @brief Constructor.
00258             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00259             /// @param name The name of the field.
00260             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00261             GravityField(const String &name, Vector3 Location);
00262             /// @brief Destructor.
00263             /// @details Class destructor.
00264             ~GravityField();
00265             /// @brief Applies the effect this field has to object inside.
00266             /// @details This function defines the behavior for the class.
00267             virtual void ApplyEffect();
00268             /// @brief Sets the gravity force for this field.
00269             /// @details Sets the strength and direction of gravity this field will have.
00270             /// @param Gravity The vector3 representing the force and direction of gravity this field will have.
00271             void SetFieldGravity(Vector3 Gravity);
00272             /// @brief Gets the gravity of this field.
00273             /// @details Gets the strength and direction of gravity this field has.
00274             /// @return Returns a vector3 representing the force and direction of gravity this field has.
00275             Vector3 GetFieldGravity();
00276     };//GravityField
00277 
00278     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00279     /// @class GravityWell
00280     /// @headerfile areaeffect.h
00281     /// @brief This is a gravity well implementation of the AreaEffect class.
00282     /// @details This class is not a gravity field, where gravity only pulls in one direction.  Instead this class will always
00283     /// pull objects inside it towards the field center.  @n
00284     /// This class works best with sphere's, but can be made to work with any shape.
00285     ///////////////////////////////////////
00286     class PHYS_LIB GravityWell : public AreaEffect
00287     {
00288         public:
00289             /// @enum These values represent the kind of attenuation applied to the field strength
00290             /// over a distance.  None is the default, where the force is constant in all area's of the
00291             /// field.  Linear is where the force applied drops by the attenuation value times the distance
00292             /// (strength - (attenuation amount * distance to AE center)).  Quadratic is where the force
00293             /// applied drops by the attenuation value times the distance squared (strength -
00294             /// (attenuation amount * distance to AE center * distance to AE center)).
00295             enum AttenuationStyle
00296             {
00297                 GW_Att_None,
00298                 GW_Att_Linear,
00299                 GW_Att_Quadratic
00300             };
00301         protected:
00302             Real Strength;
00303             bool AllowWorldGrav;
00304             AttenuationStyle AttenStyle;
00305             Real AttenAmount;
00306         public:
00307             /// @brief Constructor.
00308             /// @details Basic initialization constructor.
00309             /// @param name The name of the field.
00310             /// @param Location The location of the AE field.
00311             GravityWell(const String &name, Vector3 Location);
00312             /// @brief Destructor.
00313             /// @details Class destructor.
00314             ~GravityWell();
00315             /// @brief Applies the effect this field has to object inside.
00316             /// @details This function defines the behavior for the class.
00317             virtual void ApplyEffect();
00318             /// @brief Sets the strenth of the field.
00319             /// @details The direction of the field is based on the current position of the object in the field.
00320             /// Once that direction is calculated it will be multiplied by this value to determine the force the field will apply to the object.
00321             /// @param FieldStrength The strength the field will have when exerting force onto other objects.
00322             virtual void SetFieldStrength(const Real FieldStrength);
00323             /// @brief Gets the strength of the field.
00324             /// @return Returns a Real representing the value that is being multiplied by the direction to determine force appied to objects.
00325             virtual Real GetFieldStrength();
00326             /// @brief Sets whether or not world gravity should be removed for objects in this field.
00327             /// @remarks Changing this value while the field is in the world and active is not recommended.
00328             /// @param WorldGravity If true, then forces exerted by this field will be added to the world gravity, otherwise
00329             /// world gravity for objects inside will be set to zero.
00330             virtual void SetAllowWorldGravity(bool WorldGravity);
00331             /// @brief Gets whether or not world gravity is is removed for objects inside this field.
00332             /// @return Returns a bool indicating whether objects inside are affected by world gravity.
00333             virtual bool GetAllowWorldGravity();
00334             /// @brief Sets the attenuation for this field.
00335             /// @param Amount The amount of force that is dropped off per 1 unit of distance objects are from the AE center.
00336             /// @param Style The style of attenuation to apply, see the AttenuationStyle enum for more details.
00337             virtual void SetAttenuation(Real Amount, AttenuationStyle Style);
00338             /// @brief Gets the Style of attenuation applied.
00339             /// @details See the AttenuationStyle enum for more details.
00340             /// @return Returns the style of attenuation currently being used by this field.
00341             virtual AttenuationStyle GetAttenuationStyle();
00342             /// @brief Gets the amount force is attenuated over distance.
00343             /// @details See SetAttenuation() for more details.
00344             /// @return Returns a Real value
00345             virtual Real GetAttenuationAmount();
00346     };//GravityWell
00347 }//phys
00348 
00349 #endif
